page.title: 08 THE VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The Village Hall has been standing in Betley for 20 years and it was the villagers idea to build it.It is run by a committee of villagers and the first chairman was Mr.E.Skerret to whom there is a memorial on the wall by the stage. There are two caretakers and a gardener.The activities done there are W.I.,Darby and Joan Club, Badminton, B.A.T.S,Cubs,Brownies,Playgroup, Auctions,Weddings and other functions. It is 2.80 an hour to hire the hall and 2.00 pounds an hour for the committee room.There is a stage on which the B.A.T.S.do shows 2 or 3 times a year.The money raised is all used for maintenance and improvements of the Hall and Caretakers and Gardeners wages.The Village Hall committee organises a Bonfire and Firework display every year.
